title: How to create get Font family name from font name in a generic way to create TypeFace
body:
Hi,

I have a set of input font names, i need to create Typeface, but type face only takes font names not font family name, so i need to give the correct font family name other wise Skia sharp is returning default font.

**Input font names**
FrutigerNext Com UltraLight,
FrutigerNext Com UltraLightCn,
FrutigerNext LT Regular,
FrutigerNext LT Heavy,
FrutigerNext LT RegularCn,
FrutigerNext LT MediumCn,
FrutigerNext LT BoldCn,
FrutigerNext LT BlackIt,
FrutigerNext LT MediumIt,
FrutigerNext LT BoldIt,
FrutigerNext LT It,

so my question here is how can i get the correct font family name correctly for different fonts ?.
I have also referred https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/762 discussion, but it didn't help.
it would be really appreciable if any one could help me out.

Regards,
Jackson Paul T

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: One font-family `Frutiger Next` and different typefaces. I doubt that you have installed all font faces so just load them by stream and you will see the correct setup.

comments.author: Jack-Paul
comments.body:
Hi @Gillibald ,
I cannot use load by stream in my case, where i get input only as font name, using that i need to create a Type face, which should be generic for any kind of font, so how can i achieve it using SKTypeface.FromFamilyName() API, is there any better way to handle generic only using font name?

Regards,
Jackson Paul T

comments.author: Gillibald
comments.body: `SKTypeface.FromFamilyName()` uses the font manager to resolve fonts. So the moment you install your fonts on the system `FromFamilyName` should work
